<!-- Population --> |population_as_of = [[United States Census, 2000|2000]] |population_total = 1,357 |timezone = [[North American Central Time Zone|Central (CST)]] |utc_offset = -6 |coordinates_display = inline,title |coordinates_type = region:US_type:city |latd = 36 |latm = 16 |lats = 38 |latNS = N |longd = 92 |longm = 35 |longs = 32 |longEW = W |timezone_DST = CDT |utc_offset_DST = -5 |postal_code_type = [[ZIP code]] |postal_code = 72634 |area_code = [[Area code 870|870]] |blank_name = [[Federal Information Processing Standard|FIPS code]] |blank_info = 05-24010 |blank1_name = [[Geographic Names Information System|GNIS]] feature ID |blank1_info = |footnotes = |website = }} '''Flippin''' is a city in [[Marion County, Arkansas|Marion County]], [[Arkansas]], [[United States]]. The population was 1,357 at the [[United States Census, 2000|2000 census]].
==Geography== Flippin is located on a major non-interstate highway, US 412/62, in the Ozark Mountains near the South Shore of Bull Shoals Lake. The town lies between the White River and the Buffalo National River.
Flippin is located at {{coord|36|16|38|N|92|35|32|W|type:city}} (36.277086, -92.592222){{GR|1}}.
According to the [[United States Census Bureau]], the city has a total area of {{convert|1.8|sqmi|km2}}, all of it land.
====List Of Highways====
*[[Image:US 62 (1961).svg|20px]][[Image:US 412.svg|25px]] [[U.S. Route 62 in Arkansas|US 62]]/[[U.S. Route 412 in Arkansas|US 412]] *[[File:US 62B.svg|25px]] [[U.S. Route 62B|U.S. Route 62 Business ]] *[[File:Arkansas 178.svg|25px]] [[Highway 178 (Arkansas)|Highway 178]] *[[File:Arkansas 202.svg|25px]] [[Highway 202 (Arkansas)|Highway 202]] *[[File:Arkansas 980(Airport).svg|25px]] [[Airport Highway 980]]
==Demographics== As of the [[census]]{{GR|2}} of 2000, there were 1,357 people, 583 households, and 357 families residing in the city. The [[population density]] was 755.7 people per square mile (291.1/kmÂ²). There were 644 housing units at an average density of 358.7 per square mile (138.1/kmÂ²). The racial makeup of the city was 95.87% [[Race (United States Census)|White]], 0.44% [[Race (United States Census)|Black]] or [[Race (United States Census)|African American]], 1.11% [[Race (United States Census)|Native American]], 0.29% [[Race (United States Census)|Asian]], 0.07% from [[Race (United States Census)|other races]], and 2.21% from two or more races. 0.81% of the population were [[Race (United States Census)|Hispanic]] or [[Race (United States Census)|Latino]] of any race.
There were 583 households out of which 29.2% had children under the age of 18 living with them, 44.3% were [[Marriage|married couples]] living together, 14.2% had a female householder with no husband present, and 38.6% were non-families. 33.4% of all households were made up of individuals and 16.1% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 2.33 and the average family size was 2.99.
In the city the population was spread out with 27.9% under the age of 18, 8.7% from 18 to 24, 27.6% from 25 to 44, 20.0% from 45 to 64, and 15.8% who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 35 years. For every 100 females there were 85.4 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 74.5 males.
==Economy== Flippin is home to Diego's Fresh Mex,Subway, [[Ranger Boats]], Micro Plastics, J&P Auto Sales and Mar Tron. [[Wal-Mart]], Flippin Public Schools, Marion County Government, Actronix, Baxter Health Care, Mar-Bax Shirt Factory, Parkview Pizza,and NATCO are also top employers of Flippin citizens.
